description.narrative: (WASH): Increased country capacity and delivery of services to ensure girls, boys and women have protected and reliable access to sufficient water, sanitation and hygiene facilities in earthquake-affected areas

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
Sanitation in emergencies - improving sanitation services in communities

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

title.narrative: Nepal United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: (WASH): Increased country capacity and delivery of services to ensure girls, boys and women have protected and reliable access to sufficient water, sanitation and hygiene facilities in earthquake-affected areas

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to provide technical and financial assistance on reconstruction of water supply and sanitation facilities in communities and institutions supporting national and local reconstruction requirements. Building the capacity of government and local stakeholders was essential through various training and orientation programs to government, stakeholders and service providers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: People in the severely affected districts with access to adequate sanitation and hand washing facilities

actual.value: 2015:On-track. 279,263 people have access to emergency and sustained sanitation.

title.narrative: People in the severely affected districts with access to a sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene

actual.value: 2015:On-track. 655,910 earthquake-affected people reached with safe water for drinking, cooking, and personal hygiene through water trucking and point-of use treatment including water kits and water treatment products. An additional 455,613 people reached with sustained water services.

title.narrative: People reached with hygiene education materials and interpersonal communication

actual.value: 2015:On-track. 82,000 households reached with the provision of family hygiene kits and 631,992 people oriented on hygiene education.

title.narrative: Number of population ensured with sustained sanitation and hygiene behaviours through rehabilitation and reconstruction or demonstration programme

actual.value: 2017:13,979 beneficiaries reached through sustained sanitation (2,736 HH Toilets Supported)

title.narrative: Number of Government officials, stakeholders, cluster members and User committee having knowledge and skills in developing resilient WASH programs

actual.value: 2017:20 plumbers training events (265 beneficiaries); various actors (300) including Village and District WASH Coordination Committees (D/V WASHCC) and WASH officials received training on WASH disaster risk management (DRM); 155 WSUC members

title.narrative: Number of population ensured with sustained water, through rehabilitation and reconstruction or demonstration programme

actual.value: 2017:38,776 beneficiaries reached through sustained water services (148 Water Supply Schemes)

title.narrative: Coordination of WASH Cluster ensured and continued to provide needed assistance to the districts on recovery, reconstruction and preparedness.

target.value: 2017:At least 6 coordination meetings per year undertaken

actual.value: 2017:Eight Cluster meeting conducted with many working team meetings

title.narrative: Number of institutions ( health posts/OTPs and schools) ensured through CGD friendly WASH hardware and software support

target.value: 2017:300 WASH in Schools and 600 WASH in Health Facilities

title.narrative: Number of districts having increased institutional capacity (WASH Cluster/DWASHCC, WSSDO, Water User Committee) for WASH Recovery and Reconstruction
